On 10 June 2017 at 16:52,
jwdtlqdwbpfnawwo6ngkcjfoj3wjbawaidt4mktf@... [neat]
<neat@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
>
>
>
> Hello Everyone I am currently doing  Time Series experiments with HyperNeat and I am seeing
> extremely great results with HSine on the Substrate activation function and  I am using these on the
> CPPN:

Hi,

BTW if you're using the latest code on github then I just submitted a
fix to CPPNs/HyperNEAT. I recently added some code to bound ANN
outputs to the interval [0,1], but this also applied to the CPPNs and
therefore they could never describe a network with weights outside of
the interval [0,1] which is obviously not going to work well.

I'd try that fix first before drawing any further conclusions.

I suppose I would say that sinh(x) doesn't have a bounded output range
as some of the standard activation functions do (e.g. logistic
function, tanh). Those standard activation functions are perhaps not
ideal for CPPNs because of that.

Cheers,

Colin
